raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items   and   from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).  does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.  normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with   it is boosted to a 40% chance.  has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with   it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item   is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from  . This means   with   and   gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch. In     does not increase the flinch chance of   or Razor Fang. When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with   will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again. Pokémon with   will also obtain an item thrown at them with   (if they are not already holding anything). In  ,   has no effect in battle. When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with   has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item). Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with  , the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on. In  , bad poison is only passed on as regular poison. increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.  effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as: Non-beneficial effects, that   will not activate for, include: If the user is holding a   and uses an attack that activates  , it will not receive the 10% damage from  , but it gets boosts from both   and   (total of 69% base power increase).  normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With  , Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn. Note that if a move has an advantageous   disadvantageous side-effect,   still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example,   may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with   using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.
